reviews.review_msg: Seemed pretty nice. But you do have to put a decent amount of work in to do well, she is a tough marker for papers and tutorial attendance + participation is really important to do well

I found the lectures to be fairly interesting and informative. Some may find her speaking style a bit dry but I didn't mind. There was a weekly tutorial which she led and expects a fair bit of participation in. Grading and feedback on projects felt a bit unclear at times. I found her to respond to emails fairly quickly if you have questions.
Seems scary at first but actually really cares about her students. I would've failed this class if I didn't have basic knowledge of Japanese history and geography.
Janice is the best! Her reading assignments are a bit dry at times but overall a very fair marker and a genuinely very kind person. Would definitely recommend a class with her.

Good prof overall. Matsumura may seem intimidating at first, but she's actually quite friendly to students. We had to only read 1 article and the textbook each week. Not hard. And not a lot of assignments either. Just one short paper and one long paper, and final. But she does expect you to work really hard to earn a good grade.
